medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started one day prior to admission, after having a bowel movement at 5pm. The patient experienced lower abdominal pressure radiating into the groin, which has persisted since. Mild nausea was present, with no vomiting. Another bowel movement occurred in the evening. The patient feels pressure while voiding and has urinated multiple times since 5pm. No prior pain like this; no radiation to one side. No fevers, sweats, or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Premature birth at 32 weeks, history of cryptorchidism, no prior surgeries.
